Docs.summary: Provides a way to register, unregister, and obtain a list of tracking handlers.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Tracking handlers are objects that implement the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Services.ITrackingHandler> interface, indicating that they must be notified whenever the remoting infrastructure marshals, unmarshals, or disconnects an object or proxy. Every object that is registered with TrackingServices is called by remoting when an object or proxy in the current <xref:System.AppDomain> is marshaled, unmarshaled, or disconnected.
All methods in the TrackingServices class are static and operate on the tracking handlers in the current <xref:System.AppDomain>.
> [!NOTE] > This class makes a link demand. A SecurityException is thrown if the immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission. See [Link Demands](../Topic/Link%20Demands.md) for more information.
